text: Sunlight pours through the window of an empty, silent dor room. The room seems alive, somehow. As if it's waiting patiently for this year's kids. A long beat. The room darkens for an instant. Just the su right, dipping behind a cloud? Maybe.
OVER CREDITS, we PAN DOWN a hallway full of COLLEGE KIDS. They carry boxes, stereo speakers, stand around chatting.

SARA MATTHEWS, 18, gets out of a taxi in front of a dorm. She's pretty, with optimistic eyes and brown hair cut jus above her shoulders. She's dressed casually, but still ch No parents. She carries a backpack on one shoulder, a duffle bag on t other, and a huge suitcase in her hand. And she's staring through the building's window at... Newly-minted COLLEGE STUDENTS milling about inside. Their parents in tow, pride and sadness mingled in their faces.
Sara walks to the registration table. A RESIDENT ASSISTAN smiles up at her.

Hi. Sara Matthews. She looks her up in the computer. She plays with a simple silver chain around her neck. R.A. Des Moines, Iowa. Wow. Flyover country. She says it nicely, but it still stings. Sara smiles game R.A. You're in room three-sixteen. Welcome. She hands Sara a room key. She fingers it, smiling. 2.

ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN ON Sara as she... Pushes an ancient, flat-bed cart out of the elevator and the hall, struggling to control its wobbly wheels. She bu into other carts, but everyone just laughs it off. Sara stops in front of Room 316.

She opens the door and looks in on: A run-of-the-mill freshman dorm room. Tiny; bathroom down hall; twin beds. Heaven. Sara steps in. She looks at the two empty beds. Big choic here. She drops her stuff on the bed by the window. She sits down on it. A beat. I'm really here. First things first -- Sara takes a framed picture out of duffle bag and sets it on the dresser. It's a picture of YOUNG GIRL, maybe ten. She looks a little like Sara. Sara hauls a white, Styrofoam DESIGN MANNEQUIN off the ca It's full of pin and chalk marks. She sets it by her bed.
Told you we'd make it. She steps back to the doorway. As she hauls her suitcase the cart... BOOM! Another cart slams into hers. A box tum off the other cart.

Sorry! Bad driver. Sara kneels to help the other girl -- cute, frizzy hair - clean up the mess. A slew of clothes lie on the carpet. A peeking out from under them... a bottle of vodka. The gir smiles sheepishly.
In case of emergency.
I'm Tracy.
Sara. 3. Balancing boxes, they manage to shake hands.
A gorgeous fall day. Sara strolls across the quad, taking all in. Kids tossing frisbees... hacky-sacking... sunning the grass. Music pours out of speakers mounted in dorm windows.
Sara's cell phone buzzes. She answers it.
Hey. Yeah, it's amazing here. I met this really cool biker? He's taking me to Mexico this weekend.
Hello?
Hi, Mom. Just tell him I'm kidding. Sara stops in front of the campus coffee shop. She eyes a work/study ad on the wall.
Everything's great.
No, she's not here yet so I got to choose my side of the room. She tears a tab off the flyer.
Establishing shot of Carnegie, a solid red-brick dorm.

Sara's half-settled in now. The wall beside her bed is peppered with fashion pages ripped out of Vogue and In St She sits in a lounge chair, paging through a Vanity Fair photo shoot. She spots a cool outfit and tears out the pa A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Sara walks over. She opens it expectantly to see... 4. Tracy, Tracy's roommate KIM, and two other HALLMATES. All dressed to party.
Psi U.'s throwing a bash. Let's go.
Psi U.?
They're a frat. Beer... guys...
I don't know... I might just hang and wait for my roommate. Groans all around. "Come on"... "Lame-O"... Sara bites he lip, considering. She smiles.
Alright. Just let me change. The girls cheer.
Establishing shot of a proud frat house. Students piled o giant porch and there's a long line going up the steps to front door. Music blasts out of the windows.
Sara, Tracy, Kim and the others from the floor are at the head of the line, stepping into the house. They're met by FRAT BOUNCER.
(motions to a crowded keg) If you want beer, I'll need ID's.
For a frat party?! Seriously? He holds up a handful of ugly lime-green wristbands. Kim steps around him.
I don't drink anyway. Tracy looks at her, mouth agape. 5.
There's punch and non-alcoholic beer over there... He points to a table with a giant bowl and cups. No one i around it. Tracy tries to flirt with the bouncer.
Come on, just us. We won't tell. The bouncer is tempted but not budging.
Honestly, I'm just a pledge. They'll kick me out. She stomps by him.
Wuss. Defeated, Tracy walks over to the table. Turns back to Sa
You want something to drink?

What's the point? Tracy huffs as Sara walks into A SEA OF KIDS. We're talki extreme fire hazard... extreme moral hazard. Sara moves through the crowd. Her clothes are low-wattage but stylish. She's drawn to the music coming from a large room. A HIGH-ENERGY COLLEGE BAND on stage. They're not very goo but they don't care. Sara finds a spot along the wall and watches them. In particular -- THE DRUMMER. A cute goof, spastically whaling away. He's mouthing the lyrics, eyes closed. Really into it. Sara chuckles at the sight, not taking her eyes off him. He definitely stands out. Suddenly, a hand grabs her shoulder. Tracy pulls herself with Kim close behind and they start dancing to the band. Juice spilling over the brim of her cup. Sara stays by th wall, afraid of getting any spilled on her. 6.
(yells over the music) Why aren't you dancing?
To this?
They're not that bad. Tracy pulls Sara deeper in the crowd. Now all three start jumping up and down to the music. Sara's getting into it Tracy chugs her drink.
A DJ rules the room now. Sara and Kim are dancing with others from the floor. Sara notices a speck of punch on h shirt. She stops dancing. Wets her fingers and tries to r it out.
Crap. Kim still dances as Sara starts to look around.
Where's Tracy?

She was getting more punch. Sara then spots Tracy, with a full cup, precariously clim onto the stage next to the DJ's table with a bunch of oth girls already dancing. She starts dancing suggestively, egging on the crowd.
Uh oh. Guys yell out. "Show em." Several hands armed with camera phones stretch out above the crowd.
Tracy. Tracy can't hear her. Sara starts making her way to the stage. Tracy is dancing, getting into it. She grabs the bottom of her shirt. Teases the crowd. 7.
Tracy. Don't. Sara slams into STEPHEN, 21, the DRUMMER from the band... inadvertently dumps his whole beer down her shirt. Sara gasps.
Damn! Sara's drenched as an enormous cheer erupts from the crow Camera phones clicking all at once. Sara looks up.
Oh. Woops.
I have to go clean this up. She turns.
Looks like my plan backfired. Sara turns back towards him.
What plan?
To spill beer on you so I can start a conversation.
You spilled beer on me purposely?
You pissed? She looks at him. Pretty good looking. Goofy smile. It's hard to be mad at him. She then grabs a beer out of a dancing partier's hand and dumps it on Stephen.
I'll get over it. He laughs, making her smile. 8.
I'm not sure how she's so wasted. All she's had is punch. Stephen grins conspiratorially and grabs her hand.
Come on.
Stephen, now with a full beer watches as Sara sips some o the punch.
It's pretty good. She drinks some more.
It doesn't taste that strong.
Exactly. He takes a drink of his beer as Sara takes a long chug of hers.
Stephen. By the way.
Sara.

Stephen and Sara are dancing. She's holding her cup. Drinking, bumping into a couple of people. Stephen laughs grabs her hand, pulling her back towards him and TWIRLS h bringing her close. She notices, for the first time, that he's not wearing a wristband and grabs his wrist with her other hand.
Hey, why do you get to drink beer?
Twenty-one.
Old man. 9.
Tell me about it. My back is killing me. They don't move for a moment, Sara's resting her back aga his chest.
Besides, frat brothers don't have to wear those ugly wristbands.
Ugh. You're in this frat? He jokingly untwirls her away and she bumps into people behind her. Sara laughs as she notices Kim, dancing, Holding up a cup of punch.
Did you try the punch? It's pretty good.
What happened to Tracy? Kim shrugs.
I'm the worst roommate ever. Kim goes back to dancing Sara looks a little worried whic Stephen notices.
Do you want to look for your friend? Sara looks at him sweetly. Nods.
They spot Tracy propped up against the railing at the bot of the stairs. Sara rushes over to her. A couple frat boy stand over her. Not sure what to do with her.
I got her. 10. She struggles to hold Tracy up -- the girl's heavier than looks and Sara's balance is not so great, herself. The fr boys notice her struggling.
Who's got you? Tracy nearly brings Sara down to the floor... But Stephen's there to catch her.
Guess that would be me. But then he stumbles, nearly dropping them both.
Who's got you? Stephen looks at Tracy in one arm. The other arm around Sara's waist.
Apparently God. Sara rolls her eyes.
Sara, Stephen, and Tracy stumble into the dorm lobby. Sar wears a jacket Stephen gave her for the walk. Kim and ANOTHER GIRL step forward and grab Tracy.
Thanks Sara.
No problem. They linger, smiling, checking out Stephen... They step i the elevator. Holding it for Sara.
You want us to wait? Sara turns and glares at Kim. An obvious "NO!" Kim lets t doors close as Sara turns back to Stephen. 11.

You know, I'm going to be pulling kitchen duty all week for helping girls leave a frat party. It's like opposite everything we stand for. Sara leans in and gives him a long kiss. Then separates, her lips still very close to his.
(low and romantic) Does that make it worth it?
Honestly, no. She laughs out loud.
Do you want to come up?
More than I can tell you, but that wouldn't be fair. Sara starts to take off Stephen's jacket. He stops her.
Keep it... till next time.
Thanks again. For everything.
And, sorry about kitchen duty. He smiles... and walks away into the night. Sara looks af him... and now it's her turn to take a deep breath which suddenly makes her a little more queasy.
Sara heads for her room, holding onto the wall as she goe She reaches her door. She takes one more deep breath, the opens it. 12.
Sara closes the door behind her. Almost pitch black; just little moonlight through the window. Sara knocks into her lounge chair.

Ow! She reaches her bed and plops down on her back. Breathing hard. Clenching her eyes shut. The room is spinning. She puke at any second. She struggles to sit up. She fumbles for the lamp next to bed, almost knocking it over. She hits the switch, reveal The other bed. Sara screams.
Hi. FLASH. The girl takes her picture, further blinding and disorienting Sara.
Who are you?!
Rebecca. Your roommate. Sara calms, catching on.
What are you doing?
Taking your picture.
Why? Rebecca shrugs. Sara grabs her stomach.
Oh shit. Her cheeks chipmunk as she rushes out the door. Rebecca smiles. 13.
Sara gingerly walks out of the bathroom back to her room, holding her head. The door is slightly open.
It's dark. Rebecca's covers are pulled up to her neck. He eyes are closed.
Rebecca? No answer. Sara makes it back to her bed. She falls onto and turns toward the wall. Rebecca's eyes open. And they stay open. She watches Sara to sleep.
It's the middle of the day and students carry their books everywhere.

Sara wakes. Headache; dry mouth; the works. The sun throu the window is way too bright. She slowly turns over to se Rebecca, up and about, arranging her side of the room. In light of day, we see that she's a knockout. Mellow music plays through top-of-the line speakers that flank an awesome stereo system. Rebecca sees that Sara's awake.
Hey Sara. Sara stares at her blankly. Who is this girl? What happen last night? Rebecca smiles.
We met last night. 14.
Right... (racking her brain) Starts with a... "T"?
Close. Rebecca. She hands Sara a glass of water and two aspirin.
Come on. It'll help, trust me. Sara washes down the aspirin.
Thanks. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched.
I didn't throw up on you, did I?

No. You made it to the bathroom. Sara looks around the room. Her lounge chair has been mov to her side. Rebecca starts to tape drawings to the wall.. .They're va self-portraits of Rebecca. Sara looks at one where Rebecc is staring straight back at us. No smile.
Did you do those? Rebecca nods.
They're really cool.
I just like capturing my moods. A beat. Sara closes her eyes. Bits and pieces of the nigh before are coming back to her now.
Rebecca -- did you take my picture last night? 15.
Yeah. It's just something I do. For my drawings.
C'mon, let's hit the bookstore. The walk will help your head. Sara rolls over, groaning.
It's too damn early for me.
It's three in the afternoon. Sara's eyes bug out.
Holy shit!

Sara walks along the back aisle, weighed down with textbo All look used and worn. Fashion Design. Psychology. Calcu She spots the last book she needs and reaches for it just another GIRL reaches too. They both pull back, neither su who has claim to it.
So what do we do? Sara looks her over. Checks out her outfit.
Nice bag. Dior?
Yeah. Sara snatches the book.
I'm on financial aid. 16.

Sara finds Rebecca by the art supplies, she's picking up stuff she needs. Sara scans Rebecca's books. They're all art books, shiny and new. Sara's phone rings. She looks at it: "JASON". She sighs. Her finger hovers over the "talk" button. A be She hits it right before it goes to voicemail.
Jason. What are you doing?
I just wanted to hear your voice.
I told you not to do this.
I need to talk to you.
You're just making it harder.
Sara, listen I... I want to come out there.
But you didn't come out here, remember. That's the problem. She says it too loud. Other students in line are eyeing h
I've gotta go. Sara hangs up. She exhales, flustered.
That didn't sound good. Boyfriend?
Ex. Off Rebecca's confused look. 17.
It's complicated. A beat. Rebecca's warm smile makes Sara want to open up. They walk along the stacks of books.
We dated since tenth grade and were supposed to go to college together.
We both applied to Brown. I got in; he got wait-listed. I stuck to our agreement and we both committed here. Then two weeks ago...a spot opened up at Brown ...and..
No?! He took it? (Sara nods glumly) What an asshole.
Yep.
Do you miss him?
Sometimes I think I do.
It's hard to let go.
Believe me, I know. But, you're in college now. A girl's gotta move on. Sara smiles, glad to find a kindred spirit. She looks at phone... and stuffs it into her pocket as they reach the register.
Rebecca sits on her bed, drawing. Sara is putting her boo away on a shelf. As she reaches the end of it, she notice something out of the corner of her eye.
Oh my God.
What? 18. Sara walks to the closet. Her modest clothes hang on one side. But the other side is now taken up by Rebecca's KIL COLLECTION.
I am so jealous.
I know... I've got a lot of clothes. Mind if I put some on your side?
No problem.

Borrow anything you want. Really. I haven't worn half of them. Sara reverently fingers through them. Chloe. De La Renta. Alexander McQueen. Jimmy Choo shoes. A Miu Miu handbag. S still carry their price tags.
Jesus, some of these I've only ever seen in Vogue.
My parents idea of bonding is to turn me loose in Beverly Hills with a Platinum card.
Oh, you here?
Pasadena. Off Sara's confused look.
About 20 minutes away.
That's cool. You can go home on weekends. Free laundry. Free meals.
Not gonna happen. Sara gives her a puzzled stare. 19.
It's a long story.. .Let's just say nothing's free in my house. She wants to know more... but it's too soon to pry. She n at Rebecca's drawing pad.
Can I take a look? She walks over. Rebecca clutches the pad to her chest.
No. Sara stops dead in her tracks. Rebecca realizes that came across pretty harsh.
Not till it's done. Nothing personal. It's just my... process.
I wouldn't want to show you anything unless it was perfect.
Sure.
Establishing shot of a big college cafeteria.
Sara and Rebecca have just finished their dinner.
I thought you were a design major. Why are you taking Calc and psychology? The girls get up with their trays.
(with a smirk) I am. I want to be well-rounded. (off her look) And they're requirements. 20.
Hey Sara. Sara sees Tracy sitting by the window with Kim. Sara walk over, but Rebecca doesn't follow.
Hey. Tracy... Kim... this is my roommate, Rebecca. She turns, but Rebecca is standing at a distance. Sara wa her over. Rebecca comes, reluctantly. She flashes a small wave.
Hi.
RRRRRREBECCA. How formal. What can we call you?
How 'bout Reba? Tracy sticks her finger down her throat. Gag me.
I like Becca. Tracy's grimace vetoes that one, too.
How 'bout Becky?
Becky's good. The girls all turn to Rebecca for approval.
I like Rebecca. Buzzkill.
Rebecca walks out. Sara shrugs at Tracy and Kim. 21.
Sara enters the Design building.
Sara peeks in the open door of a classroom. Frustration i her eyes -- the class she couldn't get into. She watches PROFESSOR ROBERTS -- long-haired, dashing -- lecture his students.

So... here we are. Design 101. And each one of you is asking yourself the same question... (he taps his own chest) Who is this guy? Why should I turn off my Blackberry and pay attention to him? Mild laughter from the class.

I'll tell you why -- because I hold the keys to the kingdom. Think of your favorite designers. Marc Jacobs. Vera Wang. Rick Owens. Magicians, right? I've got news for you: All of their magic stems from the same source: the fundamental principles of design.
I can teach you those principles. He lets the power of his words sink in.
The journey to the catwalks of New York... Paris... Tokyo... starts right here, in this room. And all you have to do is open your minds. Man, she wants in.
Sara stands by the door, watching the students file out. the last one leaves, she screws up her courage and walks
Professor Roberts is gathering up his papers.
Professor Roberts? He flashes a disarming smile.
I'm sorry to bother you, it's just...
I absolutely must take this class.
I'm afraid we're full. But don't worry -- Intro Design has three other sections.
But you're not teaching them. I want to learn from the best. He smiles at her.
What's your name?
Sara Matthews.
I brought a request form. She holds it out to him. He takes the form, but his eyes on Sara. Roaming over her.
Tell me, Sara -- why should I sign your request form when I've turned down a dozen others? Would that be fair? Sara's face falls. A long beat. 23.
No, I guess it wouldn't. Thanks anyway. She walks toward the door. Roberts' eyes go to her ass.
But...
Who said life was fair? You happen to have two things I can't teach... He walks to her... and hands her the signed form.
Style. And Desire. He smiles, signs the form and hands it to Sara. Sara clut the form to her chest, smiling.
Sara and Rebecca sit on their respective beds. Rebecca listens to her Walkman. Sara types on her laptop.
Hey. Rebecca removes her earbud.
What's your Facebook page? I'll add you as a friend.
I don't have a Facebook page.
Myspace?
Nope. I don't spend a lot of time
Sara stares at Rebecca. No way.

Come here. Rebecca walks over and looks at the computer over Sara's shoulder. 24. ON COMPUTER SCREEN: Sara's Facebook Page. Her picture in corner. Pictures and posts from a dozen friends. Among them: A STYLISH, ATTRACTIVE WOMAN in her 20s.
Who's she?
Irene. She graduated from the Art Institute out here last year.
She's an artist?
A design apprentice for Marc Jacobs. Hey, check out these posts. Sara scrolls down Irene's recent posts: "Paris was amazing"... "Milan in the Fall"... "Off to Barcelona"...
I mean.. .who doesn't have a Facebook page?! Rebecca laughs.
Okay, okay. I'll get one. Tracy knocks on the partially open front door... and marc right in.
Cancel those library plans. Guess who made the guest list at Rebar?
You guys in? I trust you have fake IDs?
Of course.
I don't.
Yes you do. Thanks to my badass self. 25. Tracy pulls out a fake ID. She walks to Rebecca and holds out to her. A peace offering. Rebecca stares at Tracy for a beat... then goes back to h sketchbook.
I'll pass. Clubs really aren't my scene. Tracy stands there, hung out to dry, the ID in her hand.

A posh Los Angeles bar. Loud and packed to the gills with mostly young students. Sara and Tracy stand at the bar, getting jostled, looking like... two naive college kids. As they try to get the bartender's attention, older guys check them out, smiling and mouthing "Hi." Sara tries to ignore them, but Tracy's in heaven.
How great is this? No parents. No curfews.
No shit! They clink their empty glasses in a toast.
Can I? She puts her wallet and cell phone into Tracy's purse.
Too bad Rebecca blew us off. Talk about the life of the party.
Don't be mean.
I'm just saying.
She's just a little hard to get to know.
Yeah right... 26. As Tracy rolls her eyes... The BARTENDER sets two drinks down in front of them. He n down the bar at... TWO MIDDLE-AGED SUITS. Tracy flashes them a smile. Sara's so sure about this.
What do you think?
I think... Tracy raises her shot glass. She and Sara clink and drink Tracy waves at the suits again. Thanks guys.
We can do better. She takes Sara's hand and pulls her out onto the dance fl

Sara and Tracy whirl in the hot mix of bodies. Having the time of their lives. A HANDSOME GUY moves in, his eyes on Tracy. Tracy loves it. They dance together as Sara watches, smil Tracy and the handsome guy drift further away from Sara. Sara is now dancing by herself. A GUY moves in on her, bu she politely dances away. She scans the dance floor for Tracy. Where'd she go? She steps off the dance floor and scans the bar -- no sig her.
Sara walks into the crowded ladies' room.
Tracy? 27.
A bummed Sara walks out of the club alone. She rubs her a against the chill. She nervously tugs on her silver chain she scans the STRAGGLERS loitering outside.
Tracy. She takes one last peek into the club doorway, hoping aga hope that Tracy will magically appear. No luck. She starts walking down the street, away from the club. Weary and unnerved.
Rebecca lies in bed, wide awake in the dark. Her cell pho rings. She stares at it. Two more rings. She picks it up.
Hello?
Would you accept a collect call from... Sara Matthews?
Yes. She smiles.

An old school gas station on a barren corner of the city. cars in either direction. A lone white 328i BMW with a bl soft top sits next to an ancient pump. Rebecca, half asleep, climbs out and grabs the nozzle, sticking it in the fuel tank. Starts pumping.
Can I help you out? She turns to see a 20-year-old, good-looking gas station attendant. His name tag: "Rick". Rebecca sizes him up. 28.
I'm fine. Just in a hurry. She keeps pumping. Speeding it up. Rick ambles up to her, treading beyond appropriate personal space. He points to "Full Service" sign.
Just doing my job. She stands her ground as he places his hand over hers on gas pump and squeezes. She looks down at his hand on top hers. Then lets go of the pump, nudging his hand away.
All done. She pulls the nozzle out of the tank and tries to place i back at the pump. He stops her. Motions to her face.
You have a little something. No, she doesn't. He, ever so gently, rubs his index finger and thumb on he cheek to remove the imaginary smudge until he lurches bac
The hell? His crotch is wet as gasoline drips from the nozzle.
Sorry. But she does it again, holding the lever down, dousing hi head to toe. He scrambles backward out of range.
Sorry again. Rick. The nozzle's still in her hand, pouring gas in every direction. She opens her car door, grabbing a lighter. Rick's pissed. Charges towards her.

You spoiled c--- He spots the lighter in her hand. Dead stop. She absentmindedly flicks it. It sparks but doesn't light. 29. The gas is now pouring towards him. The meter on the pump still ticking up. He scrambles again as she casually flips the lighter at h and drops the still pouring nozzle. A hint of a grin and a pitying shake of her head as she p out a loose hundred dollar bill. Places it on top of the pump.
Pussy. She gets into her car and drives off. Leaving Rick soaked gasoline.

Sara sits by herself in a booth by the window. Hugging a of hot, sobering coffee. Rebecca's car pulls up into a parking spot. The headlight shine right in Sara's eyes... and now turn off. Sara's tired eyes light up as she sees Rebecca get out of car. She waves. Rebecca doesn't wave back as she heads fo the door.
Rebecca walks up to Sara's booth.
Nice car.
Thanks.
So, where's Tracy?
No idea, I couldn't find her. Rebecca sits down, dropping her purse and keys on the tab
As long as I'm here... you hungry?
Starved. Sara smiles gratefully. Rebecca opens the menu. 30.
I can't believe she ran out on you.
I know. Thanks for coming. Rebecca looks up from the menu.
Tracy had her shot tonight. Tomorrow you're all mine. I'll show you the big city.. .the right way. And I promise I won't abandon you. Deal? Sara smiles.
Deal.
Rebecca leads Sara through the sculpture room.

These are the modern pieces. A little wilder than the old stuff. She's a savvy tour guide, confident, at ease. She doesn't just walk past pieces -- she studies them. Sara's impress Sara's cell phone buzzes. She checks the display: "Jason" She tilts it so that Rebecca can see and rolls her eyes. buries her cell phone in her purse. Sara spots a bizarre metal structure and walks over to it
Okay, I have no idea what this is supposed to be.
Even I don't get that one. Come on, I want to show you something.

Rebecca shows Sara into a room full of paintings. In the background is a banner announcing an upcoming Richard Pri exhibition. 31. They stop in front of Richard Prince's "Nurse of Greenmeadow." It's a portrait of a woman in a nurse's mas Her eyes peer directly at the viewer. Blood is smeared on smock.
This is my favorite. Sara steps closer to examine it. Rebecca stays behind her

I love how he captures her personality through her eyes. It's like she really wants to help you. Rebecca's hands tug anxiously at her shirt. She really wa Sara to like this painting. Sara moves even closer. She squints, trying to see what Rebecca sees. The woman's expression in the painting is actually pretty sinister. Sara's a little freaked out... but she turns to see Rebec hopeful expression. Sara brightens.
Amazing. I love it.
Sara and Rebecca window shop along a block of thrift stor Sara spots a graffiti-laden wall next to a tattoo parlor. Some first-rate tagging here -- bright colors, funky shap
That is so cool.
No graffiti in Des Moines?
Sure. "Bobby loves Jenny. Chrissy loves Rick." Nothing like this. Rebecca pulls out her camera.
Hey, smile. Sara poses... but now grabs Rebecca and pulls her in.
Both of us. 32. They both hold the camera, extended at arm's length. Rebe clicks. She looks at the picture. She can see the tattoo parlor in the background.
Now that's one "art form" I don't get. Needles into skin? No thanks.
I have a tattoo. Rebecca smiles. Yeah, right. But she can see in Sara's ey that she's serious.
Really? Sara pulls down her shirt and sweater a bit to reveal, ov her heart, a simple tattoo: "Emily".
My older sister. She died when I was nine.
Oh, I'm sorry.
(pats her heart) This keeps her with me.
I always wanted a sister. Sara smiles and interlocks her arm with Rebecca's as they walk down the street.
Sara sits on her bed in sweats, typing on her laptop. Reb sits on her own bed, glancing over at Sara as she draws.
Guess who I'm listing as my favorite artist on my Facebook page?
Richard Prince. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched. She walks over to chec out the rest of Sara's Facebook Favorites. Favorite book, favorite band, etc. 33.
Your favorite movie is "Coyote Ugly"?
Don't laugh. It's about a small town girl making it in the big city.
Isn't every movie?! They both laugh.
Sara, in shorts and warm-up jacket, runs down the sidewal Her head's on a swivel, taking in the city sights.

Rebecca takes down a few of her drawings. In their place, puts up a big "Coyote Ugly" poster. She straightens it ou Satisfied. She checks her watch and walks to the window. She looks o anxious for Sara to come home. She looks over at Sara's side of the room. Curious, she starts perusing her things. Books... CDs... She walks to Sara's dresser and picks up the picture of Emily. She tenderly brushes Emily's face with her thumb. She spots Sara's silver chain. She picks it up and places around her neck. She fingers it carefully and looks at herself in the mirror. She smiles.

Sara finishes off her run strong, striding out the last t yards to the dorm. She catches her breath and hears a kit Sara looks in-between the columns outside the dorm and fi a STRAY KITTEN. She's cute as they come, a black-and-whit furball.
Hey there. 34. The kitten purrs.
Look at you. She kneels and pets it. The kitten purrs.
No collar, baby? Sara glances around to see if anyone is watching.
Sara quickly walks in and closes the door. Rebecca sits i her windowsill, drawing. Sara sits down on her own bed. S notices the "Coyote Ugly" poster.
Wow.

I thought you'd like it. Rebecca sees the moving bulge under Sara's jacket. She cu Sara a look. Sara sighs. Apprehensively, she unzips her jacket and the kitten pops out. Rebecca sits up. The kitt jumps over to her bed. She pets it.
Sara...
I know, I know. It's stupid, and I've just broken about forty different dorm rules, and I should just take it to a shelter...
What do you want to name it? Sara's face lights up. She smiles gratefully.
Really? 35.
It'll be our secret. Just between us. Rebecca keeps petting the kitten. Getting more attached.
I named her in the elevator. Cuddles. She smiles and scoops her up. Suddenly, her smile vanishe
Is that my necklace? Rebecca touches it. She'd forgotten she still had it on.

It's not exactly the most festive holiday in the Matthews household.
Emily died two days before Thanksgiving. A beat. Rebecca pats Sara's hand.
I know I should be there with them, but it's like there's a ghost at the table.
You can come with me.
What? Rebecca sits up, her excitement growing.
Yeah, spend Thanksgiving at my house.
Your folks wouldn't mind?
Please. Like they'd even notice.
Okay, we'll see. Thanks. 69.
Professor Roberts stands at the blackboard, wrapping up a lecture.

Your midterm designs are due Friday. Remember, class: Simplicity. Who founded our industry? Eve -- when she handed Adam that fig leaf. Students laugh on their way out the door. As Sara walks p Roberts...
Sara. Could I see you in my office, please?
Sure. I've got a class right now. But I'll come right after it.

Sara knocks on Professor Roberts' open door. She steps in his office. It's small and intimate, with books stacked a every wall. Scraps of fabric are pinned to cork boards. Roberts smiles at her from his chair. He walks to the doo and closes it. He walks back, pulls a chair close to hers and sits down. She crosses her legs, her knees accidental brushing against his.
I don't think I need to tell you how impressed I've been with your work.

Every year I go to Fashion Week in Paris. It's dazzling. The photo shoots... the parties... that incredible runway. When the first model bursts through the curtain and hits that catwalk? Sara, a roar goes up from that crowd that's like... nothing you've ever heard.
The college allows me to take one student. All expenses paid.
Full backstage access. Usually, it's a senior.
But it doesn't have to be. Sara's pulse is racing.
I'm not sure I understand. Are you saying what I think you're saying?
I'm saying you have a shot. You'd have to earn it, Sara.
Of course. I'll do... anything. Roberts stands and walks to the window. He looks out at t quad... and now turns back to Sara.

I'd like to see more danger in your work. Your designs are always crisp; they're always clear. But they're a little... safe. That stung. Sara can't keep the red from rising in her fa Roberts walks over to her.
Don't be afraid to go to some of the... He delicately taps her temple.
darker places in here.
Okay... He squats beside her, his hand on her shoulder now. He lo into her eyes.
The best designers push the boundaries of what's... acceptable. They take chances. Do you like to take chances, Sara?
Sometimes. 71.
So do I. He kisses her. Sara pushes him away, jumping out of her chair. She stands in front of him, shaking.
I can't believe you just did that.
I took a chance, that's all. With a student that I trust.
I better go. Sara grabs her books. As she heads for the door...
Paris, Sara. Fashion Week. Don't blow the chance of a lifetime. She hurries out of the office.

Rebecca sits alone at a study table. Sara walks up and dr down her books. THUD. Students look over from other table Sara doesn't care. She sits down and stares blankly into space, trying to forget what just happened. Rebecca leans over, concerned.
What's wrong?
My design professor just kissed me. Rebecca turns very serious. She gets up and sits down nex to Sara.
Are you alright? Sara nods.
Yeah, it just really creeped me out. And I think the asshole's married. 72. Rebecca puts her hand on Sara's.

Professor Roberts at his desk, set to call it a day. He tosses some design sheets into his briefcase. He opens a desk drawer... grabs his wedding ring... and s it onto his finger. He hears FOOTSTEPS in the hallway. The sexy, unmistakable clicking of a woman's heels. They come closer... and now at his door. Roberts watches the door, waiting for a knock. Nothing. H walks to it. He can see the silhouette of two feet at the bottom of the door. He smiles -- Sara, coming back to him He opens the door, revealing: Rebecca. She wears a snug v-neck cardigan, skin-tight bla jeans, and silver stiletto heels. A small purse on her shoulder. Roberts swallows his surprise.
Professor Roberts?
That's right.
I'm glad I caught you.
Actually, I was just... But Rebecca steps past him into the office, her heels snapping on the worn hardwood floor.
Roberts, a little annoyed but also intrigued, follows her back inside. They face each other.
You're not one of my students.
Not yet. That's why I'm here. 73. She steps to his desk and leans against it. Her cool mann is disarming. A beat.
I'm failing Intro Pysch.
And why is that?
Because I'm bored. I thought it would be all about Freud, and deep dark secrets. But it's brain chemistry. Synapses. I can't stay awake in class.
I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm not sure what I can do to help.

Tomorrow's the last day to drop a course without penalty. Unless I can add another one in its place, I'll fall way behind in credits. Daddy won't take that very well. He might even pull the plug. Which means...
I'm pretty much at your mercy, Professor. Roberts smiles. This girl is a trip. Is she for real? She so calm, so steady. Roberts can't get a handle on her.
Look, I've always made it a policy not to accept any students this late in the term.

Do I look like just any student to you? She smiles... and eases up onto his desk. Facing him. Pre feet dangling, ankles locked. Jesus. She eases her purse off her shoulder and onto the desk. S sees the framed picture of a WOMAN AND TWO KIDS. She pick up.
Your wife is very pretty. 74.
Ex-wife . The game is on now. Roberts slowly walks around the desk, until he's behind Rebecca. In the picture frame's reflection, Rebecca sees him slip his wedding ring. He palms it.
A few things I'd need to know.
Ask me anything. He's circling the desk now. Predator and prey.
Do you have any design experience?
None.
What do you know about clothes?
Only one thing.
And what's that?
I definitely look better out of them than in them. What an answer. Roberts stops in front of her. He moves i close, between her parting legs. He looks into her eyes. Still steady.
I think we might be able to work something out.
Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.
Kiss me.

I'll take it from there. 75. He kisses her. She opens her lips for a tantalizing secon and now gently pushes him away. He holds his ground. He's a taste -- he wants a lot more. Suddenly, Rebecca's face hardens.

Ow! You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Roberts stares at her in shock. He's not even touching he What's going on? Rebecca smiles again. This girl is whacked. But damn, Roberts wants her. And he eyes are inviting him back. As he presses in to kiss her again... She rockets a knee into his groin and he crumples to the floor, gasping for air. He drops his wedding ring, which rolls away across the floor. Rebecca steps to the desk, where her purse sits open. We see the Walkman inside. She takes it out. Smiles at him.
Birthday gift. You should get one, they're great. She slips on the earbuds... plays with the Walkman for a seconds... and now hits the play button. We hear their pr conversation, played back.
Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.
Kiss me. I'll take it from there.
Owl You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Rage and betrayal in Roberts' eyes.
You bitch tease!
Oh, I'm not teasing. She starts to circle him now, as he writhes in pain on th floor. 76.
Do you see enough danger in me now, Professor? Did I go to a dark enough place for you? He recognizes his own words to Sara.
What? How did?... Who are you? He lunges at her ankle. She steps out of his grasp... and slams the sharp spike of her heel down on his hand. He ye again.
She trusted you. She walks toward the door.
Please don't do this. Twenty years. Everything I worked for. I'll pay for that tape. Rebecca stops at the door. She kneels, picks up his weddi ring, and rolls it across the floor to him.
Yes you will. She walks out the door.
Sara sits on Stephen's bed. She is looking out the window holding a theory book in her hand. Stephen watches her from his side of the bed.
Anything wrong? Sara is taken out of her own world
What?
Are you ok?
Yeah, sure. 77. She smiles. Stephen smiles back. Sara looks down in her book again.
Sara looks up at the building. She sighs before she enter
She walks slowly toward the classroom, letting other stud pass her. She steps into the doorway and sees...
A WOMAN, standing at Professor Roberts' podium. She gestu for everyone to come in. Sara, like the rest, is confused
Welcome. I'm Professor Jacobs. I'll be taking over the class for the rest of the semester. Sara can't believe it. She takes a seat and turns to the STUDENT next to her.
What happened?
Sara walks in with a tray, still a bit dazed. She sees a dozen hallmates milling about and Rebecca sitting by hers in the corner, drawing. Sara joins her.
Remember what I told you about Professor Roberts?
Yeah?
He's gone.
What do you mean? 78.
Well, they're calling it a leave of absence. But what I heard... someone sent the dean an anonymous recording of him hitting on another student.
Oh My God.
I know.
That's called Karma.
Sara serves up two fresh lattes... and now leans against counter to watch the band. Stephen's band. He catches her looking at him. She smiles. Seriously smitten.
Stephen, sweaty, is behind the counter helping Sara clean
I've made a decision. You ready?
Lemme hear it.
I'm gonna quit the band.
No. Really? Why?
It's a waste of time-and we suck.
Why would you say that?
Well, let me think about this. The only places we can get booked is at my own frat house and at my girlfriend's coffee shop. 79.
You're right. You guys do suck. A beat.
Hold it. Did you just say girlfriend?
You heard me.
So you think it'll be fun to stay here during Thanksgiving?
Dinner at the frat, the football games. Don't forget the always awkward, homoerotic humor.
Sounds like a blast.
Oh. For sure.

A somber Rebecca stares at herself in the full-length mir on the back of the front door. A very strange expression her eyes. She looks herself over, makes a fist, and now.. Punches herself on the temple. Hard. She staggers, nearly knocked out. She straightens. Looks in the mirror. Her sk is already bruising. She punches herself again. Same spot And again, with her other fist this time. And now a shot her shoulder. And another. It's painful to watch. But she getting more and more numb to the blows. She inspects herself closely... and now reaches down and grabs an artist's UTILITY KNIFE. It looks like a large, retractable box cutter. She extends the blade all the way out. She pulls up her shirt. Turns to the side a bit. Pla the knife against her skin and...
Sara opens the door and finds Rebecca curled up in a feta position in a corner of the room. Sobbing. Sara drops her things and runs over to her.
Oh my God. What happened? She cradles Rebecca, who buries her head in between her knees. Sara checks the bruises on her head and arms.
Rebecca. It's okay. You're safe now. Talk to me.
I was looking for Cuddles. A man... pulled me into an alley. He tried... Sara holds her. She can't finish.
It's okay. It's okay. Shhh.
I got away.
You're alright now. Sara notices a streak of blood against Rebecca's shirt. S pulls it up and sees a slash. Gasps.
Rebecca, newly showered, hair still wet, sits on her bed her underwear. Sara is tending to her wounds. Ice for the bruises. Disinfectant for the cut. Rebecca flinches.
It's not deep, thank God. But you should see a doctor.
No.
Rebecca, you need to. And then the police. 81. Rebecca pulls back on her bed, ruining the gauze job.
I don't want to. I can't. Sara pulls out her cell phone.
You're calling them, or I am. There's a psycho walking around this campus.
Please. I didn't see him. She's so frazzled, she's undoing Sara's nursing efforts.
Okay, okay. I won't call. Just let me help you. Rebecca calms down. Let's Sara finish. Watching her inten as she works.
Sara's on the sidewalk in front of her dorm with Stephen. Inside, the lobby is busy with students getting ready to home for the holiday.
Sorry about not staying. But, Rebecca...
I get it.
I'm going to make out with my pillow and pretend it's you.
Just say you'll miss me.
I'll miss you. Rebecca pulls up in her car. Sara gets in. Rebecca gives Stephen an "I win" look as Sara closes the door. 82.
Sara looks down at her phone.
I haven't heard from Jason in weeks. It's weird how he just stopped calling.
It's what you wanted, right? Sara nods, reassuring herself.
Yeah. Yeah it is. Sara looks out the window. Rebecca shows a hint of a smil
Rebecca's car pulls up to the iron gates of a huge mansio that could be straight out of Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous.
Rebecca and Sara stand in the driveway, looking up at the mansion. Sara is in shock.
This is your home?
It's my parents house. It was never a home.
Rebecca and Sara walk in. Rebecca's on edge, flinching as Sara closes the door. Rebecca's parents rush in from the living room. Her fathe gives her an awkward hug.
We didn't think you would make it. 83. Her mother sees the bruises on her face.
What happened?
Nothing.
Nothing? This isn't nothing.
Leave it alone. Sara is stunned. But Rebecca's parents cease. Her mom giv her a tender, protracted embrace. Rebecca endures it, bar raising her arms.
Hello. And you are?
I'm Sara. She puts out her hand, but cuts Rebecca a look. You didn' tell them?
Sara's my roommate.
I'm Jeff. Rebecca's mother comes over and unexpectedly embraces Sar
It's so great to meet you, Sara. I'm Alison. Rebecca grabs Sara by the arm.
Come on, let me show you my room.
Rebecca slams the door behind them, startling Sara. 84.
You didn't tell them we were coming?

They didn't need to know. Rebecca plops down on the bed. Sara looks around. It's a typical teenage girl's bedroom. Except, no posters. Just drawings covering the walls. The drawings are of teenage girls -- more precisely, they're different drawings of on teenage girl. They're odd, but compelling.
These are interesting.
Yeah, some of my high school work. I haven't gotten around to takin them down.

Family and guest sit around a very nice, but not too larg dining table. The contents of the house are expensive but not pretentious. Rebecca plays with her food, clearly not wanting to engag her parents, who are undaunted. All smiles and warmth.
Rebecca's a pretty great artist.
Yeah, we think Rebecca is so talented. Rebecca shakes her head, uncomfortable with the flattery.
She's an awesome roommate, too.
(looks at his daughter,
That's nice to hear and I'm sure she likes you because she never brings anyone home before. Rebecca stares at her father. 85.
Dad!

What? As a parent you worry. You protect your daughter all her life and then she goes off to college and she's on her own. I'm just relieved she got a good roommate. Sara cuts discreet looks around the table. Who are these people?
Sara, I'll make up a room for you --
She'll stay in my room. Sara turns to Rebecca, confused but willing to go along.
Sara and Rebecca are getting ready to sleep. Sara has mad makeshift bed in the middle of the floor.
We can share the bed if you want. Sara looks down at her own "bed" and takes a glance at th walls. On the floor, she's going to be surrounded by the drawings of Rebecca looking at her.
Sure. Sara climbs into bed with Rebecca. They lay back to back. Rebecca turns the lamp off next to the bed.
Thanks for coming.
Next Thanksgiving, you can run interference with my family.

Done. Sara closes her eyes. It's silent. Rebecca turns over. A beat. She opens her eyes -- just inches from Sara. She ev so slowly raises her hand and gently strokes Sara's hair. 86. Sara opens her eyes for a second. Not sure if she felt something. She closes them again.
Jeff walks from the stairs into the pitch black kitchen. lived here long enough to know his way in the dark.
Jeff opens the fridge. The soft light barely illuminates Rebecca, sitting stoically at the table behind her father Jeff jumps. He recovers, standing by the open fridge.
Becs. You scared me. Rebecca, glass of milk in her hand, gives her father a di look. We know how much she hates nicknames.
Sara wakes up alone in bed. She can hear soft voices from downstairs. She climbs out of bed and walks to the door.
Sara stands at the top of the stairs. She walks down them to the kitchen doorway. She peeks inside to see...
Rebecca and her father sitting at the table. Just the moonlight through the window falling over them. Spooky.
How're you doing?
Fine. My grades are good.
That's not what I meant. She looks down at the table. 87.
I'm making friends. Jeff, very subtly, cringes. A long beat.
Rebecca, look at me for a second. Now she looks at him.
Your mother and I are very fond of you.

I know. He doesn't know what else to say. Outside Sara sees the framed photos on the wall. Each features Rebecca's parents in some exotic locale: On beach... on the ski slopes... on a cruise ship. They smil happily at the camera. Rebecca isn't in a single picture.
I just wanted to make sure. Good night, I'm heading back to bed. He rises. Sara turns and walks up the stairs.
Sara waits by the front door. Alison walks in.
Hi Sara.
Hi. Rebecca's going to show me some of her high school hangouts.
Wonderful. Alison peers up the stairs.
Rebecca seems to be doing well.
Uhhh, yeah. I think she is. 88.
Is she taking her medication?
Medication? Alison turns to see... her daughter at the top of the sta Did she hear them? She walks down.
Hey sweetheart. She kisses her on the cheek. Rebecca is annoyed.
Ready? Sara nods, but she's still reeling from Alison's words. Medication? She looks back, but Alison waves cheerfully.
Have a great time, you two.
It's an affluent but quaint little town's main street. Rebecca and Sara stroll down the sidewalk. Sara cuts discreet, sideways glances at Rebecca.
Is everything okay?
Yeah. It's just... She wants to ask her about that medication.
Nice to see where you come from.
Come on.
Sara and Rebecca are in line for their drinks. The TEENAG CASHIER takes their money... but keeps staring at Rebecca She doesn't pay any attention to him. Sara takes her coff 89.

Thanks. The cashier stares at her, as if trying to figure Sara ou What's she doing with Rebecca? The girls sit at a table. The cashier and BARISTA keep glancing over, whispering to each other. Rebecca shoots t a look. Like a warning. They quiet. Start doing busy work

I used to come here like every day after school. The door opens. THREE GIRLS walk in, laughing and chattin One BRUNETTE spots Rebecca and stops dead in her tracks. Sara recognizes her. It's MARIA, the girl from Rebecca's Facebook, and the subject of all those wall sketches. The chatting girls all fall silent.
You know them?
They went to my high school.

Friends? Rebecca doesn't answer her. She's focused on making eye contact with the Brunette. The girls linger by the door, whispering among themselves Finally, the Brunette sits down at a table by the entranc As far away from Rebecca's and Sara's table as possible. The other two girls walk to the counter. They sneak glanc at Rebecca as they order their drinks. Sara looks back and forth between Rebecca and the girls. Rebecca doesn't waver. She keeps staring at the Brunette. Suddenly, Rebecca gets up.
Let's leave. Rebecca walks towards the door. Sara, confused, gathers h things and gets up. Rebecca stops at the Brunette's table The Brunette sits there, like a deer caught in headlights 90.
Hello, Maria.

Hello. The other girls walk over. Rebecca, unfazed, looks them o sending shivers down their spines. They want to back up t friend, but they look as scared as she does. Sara watches this from a few feet away. Rebecca suddenly turns cheerful.
Oh, I wanted to introduce you to Sara. My roommate. Sara gives a small wave to Maria, who looks her over. Alm as if she feels sorry for her.
Hi. Rebecca keeps eyeing Maria, a superior grin on her face. awkward beat. Everyone's tense. Sara clears her throat.
Well, we better go. Rebecca snaps out of it. Nods. They start to walk out. Bu they open the door...
Rebecca. Everyone turns to Maria. She looks Rebecca in the eye.
We were never friends. Rebecca stares at her, grinding her teeth. The tension building. Maria doesn't back down, though. She needed to this. Sara grabs Rebecca's shoulder, gently.
Come on, let's go.
Headed back to school. Sara looks out the window. Lost in thought. 91.

I guess college is a fresh start for both of us. Rebecca doesn't look at her. Just a hint of acknowledgeme on her face. Sara's phone buzzes. This gets Rebecca's attention. Sara looks at the text message she just received from Irene: "back in LA. lemme know abt movin in."
Irene's back in town. Sara types and sends a text back. Rebecca watches her.
Sara's running through the quad.
Sara, coming in from a run, times it perfectly, sneaking the front door as a student walks out. She bypasses the elevator, heading straight to the stairs.
She bursts out the door and into the hallway.
She walks in, still a bit out of breath. Rebecca is packi her back-pack.
(not looking up) Good run?
(between deep breaths) Great. You wanna go get dinner?
I'm going to the art studio.
Oh. Okay. Catch you later then. 92.
Don't wait up, Sara...

I feel inspired. She's out the door. Sara notices that Rebecca left her sketchpad behind on her bed. She eyes it for a beat. Look the closed door. As she steps toward the sketchpad... Rebecca charges back
Forgot my pad. She snags it from her bed and leaves. Sara eyes Rebecca's dresser. But first... She walks to the door and opens it.
Sara peeks her head out and looks down both sides of the empty hallway. She hears the elevator ding.

Sara heads straight for Rebecca's dresser. A beat. Is she really going to do this? Yes. She slides open the top dra Supplies. The second drawer: sketchpads. She leafs throug them: Empty. She searches the third drawer: Sweaters. She feels around beneath them. Wait a minute. She pulls out: Two bottles of prescription medicine. "LITHIUM... For APD Both bottles are full of pills. As Sara stares at them... A HAND TAPS HER SHOULDER. She leaps out of her socks. But it's just Stephen.
Your door was open.
Oh my God.
Sorry. Sara grabs him and gives him a long hug. Stephen holds he tight and speaks, muffled by her neck. 93.
What are those? A beat. Should she bring him into this?
That's what I intend to find out.

Rebecca is standing up, back pack around her shoulder, he drawing pad in her other hand. Her arm is wrapped around pole for balance. She stares out the window. No emotion. looks like she's staring at her own reflection. The train comes to a halt. Riders shuffle around. Rebecca sees a seat open up and sits down. She opens her drawing pad and starts on a blank piece of paper. She loo up and we see what she's been staring at: Irene.
Sara and Stephen stand at Sara's desk, over her computer. Sara googles "Lithium and APD", and clicks on an entry.
APD -- anti-social personality disorder. Also known as sociopathy. They look at each other.
Jesus. I thought she was just weird.
It says lithium can control the condition. (nodding at the bottles) Maybe these are refills. Maybe she's been taking it all along.
Certainly doesn't seem like she's been taking them. He's right and she knows it. A beat. 94.
I think it's time I moved in with Irene.

A stylish, hip night club. A sophisticated crowd. Irene a three FRIENDS sit in the lounge section, sipping exotic martinis and watching the dance floor. And on that dance floor one particular woman dances by herself, lost in the music, oblivious to everything aroun her. She turns as she dances and we see that it's Rebecca Irene gets up and heads towards the bathroom. As she wind her away around the borders of the dance floor, she notic Rebecca. She pauses to watch her. THEIR EYES MEET FOR MOR

head_text.subj: THAN AN INSTANT, IRENE SMILES AND WALKS AWAY. REBECCA CLO

text: Irene stands at the mirror, fixing her make-up. The door opens and closes. She glances over to see Rebecca walking Rebecca steps to the sink, just a few feet down from Iren She's out of breath, a sexy sheen of sweat on her arms. Irene breaks out a tube of lip gloss. Rebecca is watching in the mirror, and Irene knows it. She applies the gloss smiles at the little kick it gives her. Her eyes find Rebecca's in the mirror.
I'm sorry to stare, but you are so beautiful.
Thanks. So are you. Great lips. What kind is it?
It's cinnamon. Caffeinated. A girl never knows how late she's gonna party. Rebecca smiles. A beat. 95.
Can I try it? Irene hands her the lip gloss... Rebecca takes her hand a pulls her close. She kisses Irene full on the lips.
You're right... cinnamon. Irene smiles. This room's heating up fast. Irene's eyes meet Rebecca's.
Why don't we get out of here. I'd invite you to my place, but I have a roommate.
As luck would have it, I'm only two blocks away and...no roommate.
What are we waiting for?

An alarm clock buzzes with no effect to Irene who is dead the world. She grunts and finally opens her eyes. She wip the sleep from her eyes, she looks around confused, looks the empty side of her bed where someone had obviously spe the night. Irene sits up and turns off the alarm..
Shit. She looks at an empty glass on her bedside table.

Irene get's up with the empty glass in her hand. She stumbles out into the... HALLWAY. She staggers to keep her balance on her way to the kitche We stay in the hallway as Irene enters in the kitchen and switches on the light. 96. We can see her shadow in the hallway and hear Irene fill glass. It's quiet for a moment. She drinks. She fills the glass again. Irene comes back into the hallway with glass in hand. She switches off the light in the kitchen. But as she starts go back to her room ...WHAM!! Rebecca charges out of nowhere and crashes into Irene.
Sara is going for a run through the city. She stops at an art deco apartment building.
Sara spots Irene's name on the buzzer and calls up. No answer.
She walks out the door. Looks around. And takes off runni again.
Sara, hands on hips, walks down the hallway and opens the door.
She finds Rebecca, sitting on her bed. Drawing. She light when she sees Sara.
Hey!
Hey yourself. Where were you all night? 97.

Oh, I got inspired. I just lost track of time. Sara pulls off her sweaty top and throws it in the hamper grabbing a towel. She's wearing a sportsbra, revealing he tattoo. Sara grabs a robe. A beat. She's nervous, but she needs to do this. Time for "big talk." She sits on her bed and faces Rebecca.
I want a tattoo.
Will you come with me?
Uhhh...
Please. It would mean a lot to me. I won't be able to do it without you. Sara looks into her plaintive eyes. So much want in them.
Um... sure. Okay.
The girls walk along the wall, checking out the samples.
You can't rush this, Rebecca. We can always come back.
I know what I want.
Okay. I'm out here if you need me. Sara sits down as the TATTOO ARTIST escorts Rebecca upsta She looks giddy and nervous. Sara waves. When she's gone, Sara takes out her phone and texts Irene. 98.
Sara, bored, leafs through a tattoo magazine for the 100t time. Her phone buzzes. A response from Irene: "outta town for a gig. will call when back ; )" Sara's relieved.
Rebecca walks slowly down the stairs. Wincing in pain. Sa puts the phone back in her pocket and stands up.
Let's see it. Rebecca pulls down the collar of her shirt to reveal, jus under her collarbone:
Sara, stunned speechless, starts backing away from her.
Think of me as your sister. Rebecca is oblivious to the rage building in Sara.
If you want... you can call me Emily. Sara clenches her fists. She's shaking with rage. She mov toward Rebecca, whose grin fades.

What's the matter? Sara steps up to her, inches away, ready to beat the shit of her. And Rebecca can't believe it. She's that far gone Her eyes search Sara's for an answer. Sara abruptly turns and walks out the door. Rebecca watch her leave through the front window. Sara never looks back
The elevator doors open. Sara, emotionally exhausted, ste out, carrying a box of her things. Stephen waits by the d
This is all you're taking?
I'll get the rest of my things when Irene comes back to town. He takes the box. Then notices --
Where's your necklace? She instinctively rubs the base of her neck.
I can't find it. It's okay.
Sara...
I'm not going back up there. He hands her the box. Time to man up.
Wait here. I'll go look for it. She kisses him tenderly, unbelievably appreciative.

Sara walks out to the cab. Pauses. She's tempted to look at her dorm room window... but she doesn't. Good thing, too. Rebecca sits on the ledge, looking down. Her face is blank. Not hurt, not angry -- completely blan
Rebecca still sits at the window. She holds her camera up taking a picture down below. She turns as Stephen enters. She puts the camera down. 100.
Have you seen Sara's necklace? Rebecca solemnly shakes her head. He looks around the dresser. In the drawers. Flips over Sara's pillow. Rebecc watches him.
What did I do? He stops searching. Looks at her.
She just needs to move on.
With you? He doesn't answer. He keeps searching... but he can feel Rebecca's eyes on him now. Creepy. He gives up.

If you do find it, can you let me know? Instead of answering, Rebecca raises her camera and takes picture. Stephen stares at her, unnerved. He finally snap out of it and walks out the door. She watches him go.
Sara is cleaning, trying to make a dent in a world-class mess. She doesn't mind -- a big weight's off her shoulder
You should call someone. The dean's office. Or at least your R.A. She keeps cleaning.
And tell them what? What has she really done to me? No one can do anything.
It's the weirdest thing, Stephen. The girl's own parents are afraid of her. 101.
Well, she sure scared the shit out of me. Sara really wants to change the subject. She holds up two his t-shirts.
Are these dirty or clean? Stephen sniffs the shirts.
Somewhere in between. She throws the t-shirts at him.

Sara heads to class, walking faster than usual. Bumping i people as she looks around, making sure she'll spot Rebec before Rebecca spots her. She makes it to the front door of the building. She looks back at the quads.

Sara locks the front door and heads back home. She walks down an empty quad. She slows at the sight of.. Rebecca. Walking directly towards her from the other end the quad. No one else is in sight. Sara thinks about veering off to side. No. She can do this. She walks straight ahead. Rebe keeps her pace; hooded sweater up, looking down at the pavement, listening to her Walkman. Sara takes a deep breath as they get closer to each other preparing herself for the confrontation. Ten feet away no Five... But Rebecca passes her without looking.
